data.title: Former Denver Nuggets Player Signs With New Team
data.meta_description: NBA veteran Will Barton, who had the best years of his career with the Denver Nuggets, reportedly signed with a team in Spain.
data.text:
Will Barton most recently played in the NBA last season when he was a member of the Toronto Raptors and Washington Wizards.

Barton averaged 6.8 points, 2.4 rebounds and 2.0 assists per contest while shooting 37.9% from the field and 36.7% from the three-point range in 56 games (two starts).

On Wednesday, it was announced that he has joined Fundaci√≥n CB Granada (h/t Alberto De Roa of HoopsHype).

Barton was initially the 40th pick in the 2012 NBA Draft out of Memphis and has played 11 seasons in the league.

In addition to the Raptors and Wizards, he has also spent time with the Denver Nuggets and Portland Trail Blazers.

His career averages are 11.2 points, 4.1 rebounds and 2.7 assists per contest while shooting 43.0% from the field and 35.5% from the three-point range in 679 regular season games.

Luca D'Alessandro reported details of Barton's deal.

Via D'Alessandro: "Will Barton signed a contract with CB Coviran Granada until the end of the season"

Barton was an excellent role player during his time in the NBA, and his best years came when he played for the Nuggets.

He spent part of eight seasons with the franchise and averaged 15.7 points per contest while shooting 45.2% from the field and 37.0% from the three-point range in 81 games (40 starts) during the 2018 season.

In addition, Barton helped lead the franchise to the NBA playoffs three times.

If he plays well in Spain, the 33-year-old could be a good addition to an NBA team next season.
